Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic scored 18 of his 27 points in the third quarter
The Nuggets went ahead by 17 on Strawther’s 3-pointer with 1:04 left in the first quarter
Denver reeled off 14 straight points and settled for a 65-56 halftime lead
Jokic took over offensively in the third, hitting a hook shot, a 14-foot jumper and a trio of 3-pointers to give them a 24-point lead heading into the fourth
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams were playing without key players. Utah was missing Lauri Markkanen (back) and Jordan Clarkson (heel) and started rookies Cody Williams and Kyle Filipowski
Denver guard Jamal Murray is in concussion protocol after taking a blow to his head in the Nuggets’ loss Friday, and Russell Westbrook got his first start of the season in place of Murray
Post-Match Reflections: The Jazz remain the only winless team in the NBA
Miscellaneous Highlights: Julian Strawther had a season-high 19 points
Aaron Gordon had 12 points for the Nuggets
Others: Both teams scored in double figures, led by Walker Kessler’s 18 points for Utah
Johnny Juzang had 17 points for Utah
Keyonte George scored 16 points for Utah
John Collins contributed 15 points for Utah
Collin Sexton and Brice Sensabaugh each finished with 10 points each for Utah
